content:
Folks want gotodef for trait methods to go to impl:

https://old.reddit.com/r/rust/comments/p8ak3y/is_there_a_way_to_go_to_a_specific_implementation/

I think https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/4558 has a way to make simple progress â€” add a heuristic in the IDE layer. It might also be that chalk can do this already.

So, bumping visibility of this, in case anyone wants to contribute ;)
@Jade was working on this, not sure what the status is though

I am working on this. I am just struggling with personal stuff at the moment. It's mostly (?) done on the chalk side, I have parsing, most of lowering done. There's a remaining type error I need to fix (related to a misunderstanding probably) and I have not got to it yet.

Aleksey: to answer that, chalk doesn't understand impl functions at all: I'm not even sure if they're in the IR in any way. It does however understand associated types: You can infer Normalize(<SomeType as SomeTrait>::SomeAssocType, ?X) and it will get the value of the associated type from the appropriate impl as the inference variable X. The work I'm doing on chalk is to make a NormalizeFn that will let you ask the same thing but for functions, and it will find you the appropriate function on the impl
so the value of the associated function is basically the impl id and the function id

i just have some types wrong in the implementation at present and have to also write a bunch of tests on the chalk side. I would love to get this happening in r-a by the end of summer, it's yet to be seen how cooperative the rest of my life will be with working on this project, however.
Take your time @Jade ! And no worries if life interferes, it's totally, absolutely OK to just drop the stuff on the floor if there are other priorities, or if you just feel like it!

Ah, the chalk thing seems to uncover two more TODOs for every thing I finish and I am retracting any estimates of how much time it will take because I have literally no idea.

Frustratingly, not having this feature is making working on Chalk a lot harder since there are sometimes impls of traits on tuples, for instance (which I have been refactoring into structs because they are terribly hard to find).
@matklad https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144729-wg-traits/topic/Chalk.20PR.20to.20identify.20which.20impl.20provides.20a.20function :grinning: :grinning:
